articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 15 Palestinians were killed and dozens wounded in an Israeli strike in the Gaza town of Zawayda, the official Palestinian news agency WAFA reported on Saturday, as Israel issued new evacuation orders, citing Hamas rocket fire nearby.
articles.title: At least 15 Palestinians killed in Israeli strike in central Gaza, WAFA agency says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Around 10 people were killed, including two children, and five were wounded by an Israeli strike on a residential building in the city of Nabatieh city in south Lebanon, state news agency NNA said on Saturday.
articles.title: Israeli strike in south Lebanon kills 10, injures 5, state news agency says

articles.author: Mark Trevelyan, Anastasiia Malenko, Gleb Stolyarov
articles.description: The idea that Ukraine could turn the tables on Russia seemed unthinkable before last week. The operation has raised questions about Russian surveillance and the caliber of its border fortifications and forces.
articles.title: How Russia looked the wrong way as Ukraine invaded

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Russian management of the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant said on Saturday a Ukrainian drone dropped an explosive charge on a road outside the plant, endangering its staff who use the road, the TASS news agency reported.
articles.title: Russia accuses Ukraine of bombing road near Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's foreign ministry said Ukraine had used Western rockets, likely U.S.-made HIMARS, to destroy a bridge over the Seym river in the Kursk region, killing volunteers trying to evacuate civilians.
articles.title: Russia says Ukraine used Western rockets to destroy bridge in Kursk region

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Indian medical professionals started a 24-hour shutdown of non-emergency services across the country on Saturday in protest against the brutal rape and murder of a doctor in the eastern city of Kolkata.
articles.title: Indian doctors begin 24-hour strike to protest brutal rape of medic

articles.author: Jasmine Patterson, Nicola Muirhead
articles.description: Hurricane Ernesto was weakening as it closed in on Bermuda early on Saturday, downgraded to a Category 1 storm but still threatening the British island territory with powerful winds, a dangerous storm surge and potentially deadly flooding.
articles.title: Hurricane Ernesto weakens, but still dangerous, as it closes in on Bermuda

articles.author: Deisy Buitrago, Mariela Nava
articles.description: Venezuela's political opposition and its supporters gathered in cities around the country on Saturday to demand recognition of what they say is their candidate's resounding victory in a presidential vote nearly three weeks ago.
articles.title: Venezuelan opposition protests as election dispute drags on

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Fifteen fire engines and around 100 firefighters were deployed to a fire at Somerset House in central London on Saturday, with clouds of black smoke visible across the city's skyline.
articles.title: Firefighters tackle large blaze at London's Somerset House

articles.author: Nyasha Chingono
articles.description: About 68 million people in Southern Africa are suffering the effects of an El Nino-induced drought which has wiped out crops across the region, the regional bloc SADC said on Saturday.
articles.title: Nearly 68 million suffering from drought in Southern Africa, says regional bloc
